messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 49 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: Guided Depth Super-Resolution by Deep Anisotropic Diffusion

Paper Abstract: Abstract Performing super-resolution of a depth image using the guidance from an RGB image is a problem that concerns several fields, such as robotics, medical imaging, and remote sensing. While deep learning methods have achieved good results in this problem, recent work highlighted the value of combining modern methods with more formal frameworks. In this work, we propose a novel approach which combines guided anisotropic diffusion with a deep convolutional network and advances the state of the art for guided depth super-resolution. The edge transferring/enhancing properties of the diffusion are boosted by the contextual reasoning capabilities of modern networks, and a strict adjustment step guarantees perfect adherence to the source image. We achieve unprecedented results in three commonly used benchmarks for guided depth super-resolution. The performance gain compared to other methods is the largest at larger scales, such as Ã—\times32 scaling. Code111 https://github.com/prs-eth/Diffusion-Super-Resolution for the proposed method is available to promote reproducibility of our results.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 49 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 49"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "RGB guided thermal super-resolution enhancement",
        "Guided anisotropic diffusion and iterative learning for weakly supervised change detection",
        "Deep monocular depth estimation leveraging a large-scale outdoor stereo dataset",
        "Weakly supervised change detection using guided anisotropic diffusion",
        "Learning graph regularisation for guided super-resolution",
        "Guided super-resolution as pixel-to-pixel transformation",
        "Imagenet: A large-scale hierarchical image database",
        "An application of Markov random fields to range sensing",
        "Image-guided ToF depth upsampling: a survey",
        "Robust guided image filtering using nonconvex potentials",
        "Guided image filtering",
        "Deep residual learning for image recognition",
        "Towards fast and accurate real-world depth super-resolution: Benchmark dataset and baseline",
        "Evaluation of cost functions for stereo matching",
        "Depth map super-resolution by deep multi-scale guidance",
        "Model-based multispectral sharpening",
        "Cubic convolution interpolation for digital image processing",
        "Deformable kernel networks for joint image filtering",
        "Deep stereo confidence prediction for depth estimation",
        "Structure selective depth superresolution for RGB-D cameras",
        "Deep monocular depth estimation via integration of global and local predictions",
        "Adam: A method for stochastic optimization",
        "Super-resolution of Sentinel-2 images: Learning a globally applicable deep neural network",
        "Guided depth enhancement via anisotropic diffusion",
        "Constant time weighted median filtering for stereo matching and beyond",
        "Patch based synthesis for single depth image super-resolution",
        "Depth video enhancement based on weighted mode filtering",
        "As-planar-as-possible depth map estimation",
        "PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library",
        "Multispectral band sharpening using pseudoinverse estimation and fuzzy reasoning",
        "Scale-space and edge detection using anisotropic diffusion",
        "Mathematical theory of optimal processes",
        "A deep primal-dual network for guided depth super-resolution",
        "U-net: Convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation",
        "Joint graph-based depth refinement and normal estimation",
        "High-resolution stereo datasets with subpixel-accurate ground truth",
        "Learning conditional random fields for stereo",
        "High-accuracy stereo depth maps using structured light",
        "A taxonomy and evaluation of dense two-frame stereo correspondence algorithms",
        "Fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation",
        "Channel attention based iterative residual learning for depth map super-resolution",
        "Guided deep decoder: Unsupervised image pair fusion",
        "Deep image prior",
        "Multi-direction dictionary learning based depth map super-resolution with autoregressive modeling",
        "Deep color guided coarse-to-fine convolutional network cascade for depth image super-resolution",
        "Edge-guided single depth image super resolution",
        "Spatial-depth super resolution for range images",
        "PMBANet: Progressive multi-branch aggregation network for scene depth super-resolution",
        "Longitudinally guided super-resolution of neonatal brain magnetic resonance images"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 49 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in Guided Depth Super-Resolution by Deep Anisotropic Diffusion, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
